p: For example, in Nigeria, Udegbunam and colleagues investigated the wound healing and antibacterial properties of Pupalia lappacea Juss [ 16], Crinum jagus [ 17] and Stephania dinklagei [ 17]. In Ghana, Boakye et al. [ 18] determined the in vivo wound-healing activity of aqueous aerial part extract of a medicinal plant using the case of only Phyllanthus muellerianus. Also, Agyare and colleagues [ 14] evaluated the antimicrobial and wound healing potential of two plants; Justicia flava and Lannea welwitschii.
